lines.text: Particles vibrate <u>perpendicularly</u> to direction of wave
Particles vibrate <u>parallel</u> to direction of wave

secText:
Essential Question:
How can we describe the motion of a particle in a wave?

Enduring Understandings:
1. In [OBJ:expsec_m380:transverse waves], particles in the medium move perpendicular to the motion of the wave. In [OBJ:expsec_m382:longitudinal waves], particles in the medium move parallel to the motion of the wave. In [OBJ:expsec_m383:surface waves], particles in the medium move both parallel and perpendicular to the motion of the wave.
2. Position graphs of the [OBJ:expsec_m384:motion of a particle in a wave] are identical to graphs of simple harmonic motion.
